abstract: National Trust for Historic Preservation places Manhattan's South Street Seaport on list of most endangered historic places in America; cites threat posed by series of development proposals, including high-rise condominium tower, that will alter character of one of most intact 19th-century neighborhoods in city.
lead_paragraph: The designation, which the trust said came because of a series of development proposals, continues a long dispute over how best to protect the crumbling 19th-century waterfront district.

headline.main: South Street Seaport Tops Preservation Trust’s List of Endangered Historic Sites
headline.print_headline: South Street Seaport on List of Imperiled Historic Sites

snippet: The designation, which the trust said came because of a series of development proposals, continues a long dispute over how best to protect the crumbling 19th-century waterfront district.
